result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Peter H. Bork was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs, blood draw fee and DNA surcharge through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within 60 days (11/28/16) unless a payment plan has been established.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  No alcohol in the home.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.
Defendant must engage in some type of support group.

timeConds.notes: in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence on or before 2/24/17.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter H. Bork

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Peter H. Bork in court with attorney William Henry Gergen.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charge/penalties; Court reviews recomm.; Def. pleads NC to OWI5th; Court finds plea made FV&I and finds Def. guilty of OWI5th w/BAC dismissed; State heard, restitution has been paid; Atty. Gergen heard; Court imposes sentence

**W/H - 3 years PO
- 240 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. to comm. 2/24/17
- $1,800 F+C = $3,089
- $250 DNA surcharge and sample
- $26 blood draw fee
- AODA & VIP w/in 120 days
- engage in some kind of support group
- absolute sobriety, no bars
- no alcohol in house
- not operate a vehicle w/o valid driver's license
* 24 mo. Rev. & IID

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on August 17, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial on September 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Peter H. Bork in court with attorney William Henry Gergen.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussion held;  Attorney Gergen w/draws his "stop motion", proceeding on probable cause motion for arrest & PBT.  State calls dispatcher Dawn Learned, S/T.  Exhibit list prepared. Witness excused.  State calls Sgt. Michael Willmann, S/T.  Witness identifies defendant.  Witness excused.  State rests.  Defense has no witnesses.  Closing Arguments by Atty Gergen.  Court heard and denies motion finding there was probable cause.  Counsel to obtain a TSC from the clerk.

Defendant Peter H. Bork in court with attorney William Henry Gergen.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Sgt Michael Willmann, sworn & testifies; State rests and moves for bindover; defense rests; arguments made; Court finds prob cause;   Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
evidence based on lack of probable cause for PBT

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.

1:15 - Defendant Peter H. Bork in court, in custody with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller (not eligible). Intern Kevin Schmidt w/ADA Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $50,000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.
